block.p: SmithKline Beecham P.L.C. is a front-runner in the bidding for the Block Drug Company of Jersey City, the maker of Sensodyne toothpaste and Polident denture cleaners, a person close to SmithKline said today.

SmithKline Beecham P.L.C. is a front-runner in the bidding for the Block Drug Company of Jersey City, the maker of Sensodyne toothpaste and Polident denture cleaners, a person close to SmithKline said today.

Block Drug would fit well with SmithKline's oral consumer products division, which includes the Aquafresh brand. SmithKline itself is being acquired by another British pharmaceutical giant, Glaxo Wellcome, for $76 billion.
Block Drug, which is closely held, retained Goldman Sachs in June to find a buyer. Analysts expect the company to fetch around $1.2 billion, or $50 a share.

It is unclear, however, whether SmithKline will secure Block Drug, as other buyers are also expected to bid. The Wall Street Journal reported today that the Church & Dwight Company, Unilever P.L.C. and the Sara Lee Corporation are believed to have looked at the company.
